description.narrative: The objectives of the intervention is for key stakeholders and other members of the target group of Afghanistan Analysts Network (AAN) to become significantly better informed and better equipped to formulate policies, implement projects and lobby for necessary interventions thanks to AAN's research and analysis. The policies, interventions and lobby activities of AAN facilitate in creating conditions for greater stability in Afghanistan (or alternatively, help prevent greater deterioration). The objectives and expected results of the core activities are: Research and analysis. AAN's main activity will remain in its field research and analysis within seven thematic areas. Its main output will be the dispatches and reports published on the AAN website and mailings and disseminated through AAN's other communication channels. Communication. AAN will continue to disseminate information through different channels (website, presence in media, social media, seminars and conferences). An improved communication strategy will result in an increasingly effective dissemination and use of AAN's analysis, including towards Dari and Pashto speaking audiences. Mentoring and Collaboration. AAN will continue to mentor its Afghan research team and develop its collaboration with Afghan and international research institutions and universities.

Tankesmedjan Afghanistan Analysts Network (AAN) har ansökt om kärnstöd från Sida för delfinansiering av organisationens verksamhet 2017-2019. Sida föreslår ett kärnstöd på totalt 5 miljoner svenska kronor för perioden 2017-2019. AAN har fått svenskt stöd sedan starten 2009.
Insatsen syftar till att afghanska beslutsfattare, internationella givare och andra medlemmar i AANs målgrupp blir bättre informerade och rustade att formulera politik, implementera utvecklingsinsatser och bedriva påverkansarbete genom att ta del av AAN:s analyser inom följande områden: Krig och fred, det politiska landskapet, rättigheter och friheter, inklusive fokus på migrationsflöden till och från Afghanistan, regionala relationer, internationellt engagement, ekonomi och utveckling, kontext och kultur.
Insatsens totala budget 2017-2019 är på 4,4 miljoner EURO. Övriga givare förväntas vara Norge, Danmark och Schweiz. Budgeten är fortfarande inte täckt. Om AAN inte får inte tillräckligt med medel kommer budgeten att anpassas till detta.

The think-thank, Afghanistan Analysts Network (AAN), has applied for core funding from Sida for the period 2017-2019. Sida proposes core funding on a total of 5 million SEK during the period 2017-2019. AAN has received Swedish support since the beginning of the organization year 2009.
The intervention aims at key stakeholders and other members of the target group of African Analysts Network (AAN are significantly better informed and better equipped to formulate policies, implement projects, and lobby for necessary interventions because of AAN's research and analysis within the following areas: War and peace; the political landscape; rights and freedoms, including a focus on migration flows to and from Afghanistan; regional relations; international engagement; economy and development; context and culture.
The total budget of the contribution 2017-2019 is 4.4 million EURO. Other expected donors are Norway, Denmark and Switzerland . The budget is not yet covered. If AAN is not able to fund-raise, the budget will be adjusted accordingly.

participating-org.narrative: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 17.9 - Enhance international support for implementing effective and targeted capacity-building in developing countries to support national plans to implement all the Sustainable Development Goals, including through North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation.

17.9 - Öka det internationella stödet för genomförande av effektiv och riktad kapacitetsuppbyggnad i utvecklingsländerna till stöd för nationella planer för att genomföra alla målen för hållbar utveckling, inklusive genom samarbete nord–syd och syd–syd samt trepartssamarbete.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Sida assesses that the productivity of AAN was higher than expected in several regards. In a number of occasions, AAN's goals were even reached by far. Hereinafter, a detailed summary is presented, where all the years' results of AAN are being lumped together (find the total amount of annual targets for 2017-2019 in brackets): Objective 1: Research and Analysis Output 1.1: Research/Dispatches 299 dispatches published. (300) Output 1.2: Reports and Thematic Dossiers 15 reports published (15), including two AAN thematic reports and four external publications.11 thematic dossiers published. (9) Objective 2: Communication Output 2.1: An active and up-to-date English language website and social media presence 201710,48% increase in Facebook likes. (3%) - does not correlate with AAN's 2017-2019 annual work plans and reports, where a 3% increase per year is presented as AAN's annual targets. 18,08% increase in Twitter followers. (3%) 201812,92% increase in Facebook likes. (3%) 10,48% increase in Twitter followers. (3%)20192,52% increase in Facebook likes. (3%) 3,55% increase in Twitter followers. (3%) Output 2.2: Dari/Pashto publications and social media presence 105 dispatches translated and published on Dari/Pashto language site. (90) 201728.89% increase in Facebook followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%)35.6% increase in Twitter followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%) 20185.97% increase in Facebook followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%)44.60% increase in Twitter followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%) 20192,46% increase in Facebook followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%)25.62% increase in Twitter followers (Dari/Pashto). (5%) Output 2.3: Series of Podcasts in English, Dari and Pashot 18+0 podcasts in English, Dari and Pashto (30) - AAN podcasts were discontinued in 2019 due to cost-effectiveness. Output 2.4: Briefings, speaking engagements and interviews 326 background briefings carried out. (30)47 speaking engagements carried out. (15) 575 interviews conducted. (150) Output 2.5: Occasional events 8 events carried out (12) - the target amount has been changed during the programme period; from 6 per year (2017) to 3 per year (2018 & 2019). Objective 3: Mentoring and Collaboration Output 3.1: Building Afghan Research Capacity 148 dispatches authored or co-authored by AAN's Afghan researchers (75) - numbers from 2018 are based on the half-year result. Output 3.2: Institutional development 144 weekly planning meetings conducted. (135)2 impact studies (carried out as monitoring reports) (6) - target changed from 2017 to 2018 (and 2019); from 4 per year (2017) to 1 per year (2018 & 2019). Moreover, looking at results of a more qualitative character, AAN has received repeated feedback that its high-quality research and explicit standards inspire and serve as a role model for policy-makers and representatives of the international community. AAN also continues to put efforts in strengthening its Afghan research team, increasing its impact on the new generation of Afghan analysts, researchers, academics and journalists as well.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
